title: rdluffy
author: rdluffy
content: Fifa already made the draw for the matches yesterday.SourceParticipating TeamsAl-Hilal SFCWydad AC Seattle Sounders FC CR FlamengoAuckland City FCReal MadridAl Ahly SCThe championship starts on February 1st and ends on February 11thDo you think it will be easy for Real Madrid to win another world cup?I always hope to see a team outside Europe to win, but it will be hard, maybe Flamengo can play in a high level to try.

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: Quote from: rdluffy on January 14, 2023, 01:39:41 PMFifa already made the draw for the matches yesterday.SourceParticipating TeamsAl-Hilal SFCWydad AC Seattle Sounders FC CR FlamengoAuckland City FCReal MadridAl Ahly SCThe championship starts on February 1st and ends on February 11thDo you think it will be easy for Real Madrid to win another world cup?I always hope to see a team outside Europe to win, but it will be hard, maybe Flamengo can play in a high level to try.European clubs have been dominant in this competition for the past 10 years or more because the difference in quality between the top European and South American clubs is too great.South American clubs simply cannot keep up with European clubs financially and organizationally, and their best players leave early to play in the best European clubs.Honestly, I don't know how strong Flamengo is right now, but I'm sure that Real will be the favorite in their final match.It seems to me that in the last few years we have even had cases where South American clubs were eliminated before the finals?

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: Quote from: Daniel91 on January 14, 2023, 03:25:13 PMEuropean clubs have been dominant in this competition for the past 10 years or more because the difference in quality between the top European and South American clubs is too great.South American clubs simply cannot keep up with European clubs financially and organizationally, and their best players leave early to play in the best European clubs.Honestly, I don't know how strong Flamengo is right now, but I'm sure that Real will be the favorite in their final match.It seems to me that in the last few years we have even had cases where South American clubs were eliminated before the finals? Pretty hard to beat Europeans, and in my opinion it's not fair to start at semi-finals.But talking about south americans, the last champion was Corinthians in 2012 against Chelsea, it's 10 years without any title for South AmericaTake a look, since 2013:2013 - Winner - Bayer / 2nd place Raja Casablanca2014 - Winner - Real Madrid / 2nd place San Lorenzo2015 - Winner - Barcelona / 2nd place River Plate2016 - Winner - Real Madrid / 2nd place Kashima Antlers2017 - Winner - Real Madrid / 2nd place Grêmio2018 - Winner - Real Madrid  / 2nd place Al Ain2019 - Winner - Liverpool / 2nd place Flamengo2020 - Winner - Bayer / 2nd place Tigres2021 - Winner - Chelsea/ 2nd place PalmeirasSo, in, 2013, 2016, 2018 and 2020 South Americans were eliminated in Semi Finals

comments.author: Silberman
comments.body: Quote from: rdluffy on January 14, 2023, 01:39:41 PMFifa already made the draw for the matches yesterday.Al-Hilal SFCWydad AC Seattle Sounders FC CR FlamengoAuckland City FCReal MadridAl Ahly SCThe championship starts on February 1st and ends on February 11thDo you think it will be easy for Real Madrid to win another world cup?I always hope to see a team outside Europe to win, but it will be hard, maybe Flamengo can play in a high level to try.The format gives too much of an advantage to the European teams as there is almost no competition and they only have to win two games to be crowned champions, now I am not denying their quality is many times above their competitors due to the huge amount of money paid by European clubs, but I think this is something FIFA should actually look to improve, and personally I hope that at some point in the future the FIFA world cup for clubs get the same format as the regular world cup, the European clubs will still dominate but at least the tournament will be way more exciting.

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: Quote from: Silberman on January 14, 2023, 08:48:10 PMThe format gives too much of an advantage to the European teams as there is almost no competition and they only have to win two games to be crowned champions, now I am not denying their quality is many times above their competitors due to the huge amount of money paid by European clubs, but I think this is something FIFA should actually look to improve, and personally I hope that at some point in the future the FIFA world cup for clubs get the same format as the regular world cup, the European clubs will still dominate but at least the tournament will be way more exciting.Not only Europeans but South Americans, both starts at semi finals, while other teams need to play 1 or 2 more matches, this is not fair.But FIFA will change that, not only the number of matches but the whole World Cup, this is probably the last one in current format.To 2025 Club World Cup FIFA will probably do the same format as World Cup, with 32 teams and each 4 years, and of course Europeans will have more spots, followed by South Americans.Maybe with this new format the European clubs will value the World Cup more, because besides being more difficult and more desired, it will certainly have a higher prize pool than now.I tried to find the odds for the championship, but there's nothing yet, of course Real Madrid is favorite, followed by Flamengo.If there is a final between Flamengo and Real, I'll probably bet on Flamengo, depending on the odds.

comments.body: Of course, Real Madrid is the undisputed favorite to win the club WC, for him this year, it seems to me there are no problems to win the trophy for the fifth time if you just look at the list of participating teams.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: I think based on the names there it won't be that difficult for Real Madrid to win this FIFA Club World Cup this time,the only difficult team if I can call it like that maybe is Flamengo but they did not excel in their Brazilian Serie A if I recall correctly.All other teams like Seattle from the USA,Al Ahly from Egypt and the others I think are no match for Real Madrid.I think that they don't need to be that extra motivated,the team difference in quality with all other team is big and the only one as I said who can give Real problems is Flamengo,nevertheless I am not expecting them also to not be a big deal for Real Madrid,if Real Madrid does not win this it would be a real shame for them.

comments.body: Quote from: rdluffy on January 15, 2023, 11:11:28 AMTo 2025 Club World Cup FIFA will probably do the same format as World Cup, with 32 teams and each 4 years, and of course Europeans will have more spots, followed by South Americans.Maybe with this new format the European clubs will value the World Cup more, because besides being more difficult and more desired, it will certainly have a higher prize pool than now.This caught my attention as I never heard about it before. Just googled it a bit and this news is confirmed, which the very first edition likely would be played in the US in 2025, a year before the world cup there. But since arranging schedule for clubs is much harder and more complicated than for national teams, I think FIFA will need longer time to arrange it properly. It would also make the world cup for national team loss its value a little bit, because the player will have two options to win a world tournament.

comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on January 16, 2023, 05:41:03 PMI think based on the names there it won't be that difficult for Real Madrid to win this FIFA Club World Cup this time,the only difficult team if I can call it like that maybe is Flamengo but they did not excel in their Brazilian Serie A if I recall correctly.All other teams like Seattle from the USA,Al Ahly from Egypt and the others I think are no match for Real Madrid.I think that they don't need to be that extra motivated,the team difference in quality with all other team is big and the only one as I said who can give Real problems is Flamengo,nevertheless I am not expecting them also to not be a big deal for Real Madrid,if Real Madrid does not win this it would be a real shame for them.No doubt European teams have been dominant in this competition for more than a decade and Real Madrid are surely going to be winners but football sometimes can be unpredictable and history might just repeat itself eleven years ago. It was 2012, i last saw a winner from a different continent in this competition which was the final between Chelsea and Corinthians when a winning goal came when the Corinthians player paolo guerrero headed the ball into the net and secure a win for the South American champions. This was their second titles and they claim it in the hands of an European team. So i just wish the competition would get a little more interesting  by seeing another team winning the trophy this time around and the only team i feel can challenge this Madrid side is only flamengo but they too have not been in their best form recently so i think the title is just going to come back to Europe.

comments.body: Quote from: rdluffy on January 14, 2023, 01:39:41 PMFifa already made the draw for the matches yesterday.SourceParticipating TeamsAl-Hilal SFCWydad AC Seattle Sounders FC CR FlamengoAuckland City FCReal MadridAl Ahly SCThe championship starts on February 1st and ends on February 11thDo you think it will be easy for Real Madrid to win another world cup?I always hope to see a team outside Europe to win, but it will be hard, maybe Flamengo can play in a high level to try.Sure, Real Madrid is formidable, and they probably will win another Club World Cup. The last nine tournaments have all been won by European teams. It would be refreshing to see a team from another continent win for a change. Who doesn't enjoy an underdog triumph? Perhaps if teams like South America's Flamengo or North America's Seattle Sounders FC improved, they could challenge Spain's Real Madrid. It's fascinating to witness the skills and abilities of teams from all around the world as they battle against one another. Let's hope it's a thrilling and close tournament! Europe needs to be destroyed
